note.p: This Intel software is considered Pre-Release Materials and is made available under a limited Evaluation License. The Pre-Release Materials may not be fully functional, and Intel may substantially modify the Pre-Release Materials in producing any “production” version. Intel can provide no assurance that it will ever produce or make generally available a “final” or “production” version of the Pre-Release Materials. The Pre-Release Materials may not be modified or incorporated into any product; the Pre-Release Materials may not continue to be used if and once a commercial version is released; and the Pre-Released Materials, or any benchmarks, performance results, or other information relating to the Pre-Release Materials may not be disclosed to any third party.

div.p: Intel® VTune™ Profiler is a performance analysis tool that provides statistical information about your application, such as CPU statistics, cache misses for different types of memory, and more.

This tutorial explains how to profile real-time applications to find opportunities to improve performance with the use of Intel® Time Coordinated Computing Tools (Intel® TCC Tools) features such as the cache allocation library.

li.p: Building a Yocto Project*-based image containing Intel® VTune™ Profiler drivers and Intel® Time Coordinated Computing Tools (Intel® TCC Tools) layer
Finding problems that can be addressed by Intel® TCC Tools features

note.p: This tutorial applies to real-time applications running on Elkhart Lake and Tiger Lake UP3, and Intel® VTune™ Profiler 2020 U2 NDA.

div.p: For more information about Intel® TCC Tools, see the product page.
